alert.note: Alert for Lyon (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 27 at 10:55AM PDT until further notice by NWS Reno
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Nevada... Walker River Near Mason at Snyder Lane affecting Lyon County. .Warm temperatures and reservoir management will lead to continued snowmelt and subsequent flooding along the Mainstem of the Walker River. Impacts will likely be prolonged, so follow advice from your local officials. For the Mainstem Walker River...including Mason at Snyder Lane... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Walker River Near Mason at Snyder Lane. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Moderate flooding of lowlands, pasture and farmland adjacent to river throughout Mason Valley-Yerington area. Several rural and some secondary public roads flood. Yards and basements of lowest homes adjacent to the river in Mason and Yerington begin flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:35 AM PDT Saturday the stage was 11.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:35 AM PDT Saturday was 11.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain mostly steady near 11.0 feet through Sunday. The river is then forecast to slowly fall during the upcoming week, but remain above flood stage. - Flood stage is 9.8 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.1 feet on 07/04/1980. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
